p: Self-assignment tests on the microsatellite dataset correctly assigned 80.9% individuals to their population of origin and 99.9% wereÂ correctly assigned to their original continent (America, Asia). Self-assignment tests on the SNP dataset correctly assigned 97.7% of the individuals to their original population with mis-assignments usually occurring within the same country, with the exception of Costa Rica, which was usually mis-assigned to Florida.
